doc.after: Nicholas desperately wanted to go into exile in the United Kingdom following his abdication.[citation needed] The British government initially offered him asylum in Britain, but this was over-ruled by King George V who, acting on the advice of his secretary Lord Stamfordham, was worried that Nicholas' presence in the UK might provoke an uprising like the previous year's Easter Rising in Ireland.[citation needed] The French government declined to accept the Romanovs in view of increasing unrest on the Western Front and on the home front as a result of the ongoing war with Germany.[citation needed]
